messages.content:
Answer the given question. You must conduct reasoning inside <think> and </think> first every time you get new information. After reasoning, if you find you lack some knowledge, you can call a search engine by <search> query </search> and it will return the top searched results between <information> and </information>. You can search as many times as your want. If you find no further external knowledge needed, you can directly provide the answer inside <answer> and </answer>, without detailed illustrations. For example, <answer> Beijing </answer>. Question: What are the world's busiest airports by passenger traffic? List the top ten busiest airports between 2020-2024 (including 2020 and 2024). I want to know about their rank, specific location (including city, district, road), total passengers (with precision to the person) and code(IATA/ICAO). 

 Please organize the results in one Markdown table with the following column names in order: 
Year, Airport, Rank, Location, Total Passengers, Code(IATA/ICAO) 

Don't ask me any questions, just output the results according to the columns without omitting cells arbitrarily. The output format is ```markdown
{data_content}
```.?

<think>
To start, I need to gather data on the world's busiest airports by passenger traffic for each year from 2020 to 2024. This requires yearly updates on airport rankings and their specific details.
</think>

<search> world's busiest airports by passenger traffic 2020-2024 </search>

Search query: world's busiest airports by passenger traffic 2020-2024
Result: [Doc 1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_busiest_airports_by_passenger_traffic):
List of busiest airports by passenger traffic 2023 statistics · 1. United States · Hartsfield–Jackson Atlanta International Airport · 2. United Arab Emirates · Dubai International Airport · 3. United States.

[Doc 2](https://www.oag.com/busiest-airports-world-2024):
Busiest Airports in the World 2024 The Busiest Airport in 2024 was Atlanta Hartsfield-Jackson International Airport (ATL) with 62.7 million seats. · The second busiest airport globally was Dubai ...

[Doc 3](https://www.statista.com/chart/19007/busiest-airports-by-passenger-traffic/?srsltid=AfmBOopqO1a21PU4NTTsTSk0BGFin9XJ-UTCUW2xoZ9x5QgGwFyQMlUo):
Chart: The World's Busiest Airports Atlanta Hartsfield-Jackson once more held the title of the airport with the highest volume of passenger traffic last year, serving 108 million ...

Search query: Atlanta Hartsfield-Jackson International Airport location
Result: [Doc 1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hartsfield%E2%80%93Jackson_Atlanta_International_Airport):
Hartsfield–Jackson Atlanta International Airport - Wikipedia Located 10 mi (16 km; 8.7 nmi) south of the Downtown Atlanta district, it is named after former Atlanta mayors William B. Hartsfield and Maynard Jackson.

[Doc 2](https://maps.apple.com/place?auid=9581724435150872302):
Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport - Apple Maps The airport is located 10 mi south of the Downtown Atlanta district. It is named after former Atlanta mayors William B. Hartsfield and Maynard Jackson.

[Doc 3](https://www.atl.com/maps/):
Terminal Maps - The official website of Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta ... Hartsfield-Jackson is near Interstates 20, 75, 85 and 285, and is approximately 20 minutes south of downtown Atlanta during normal traffic. Hartsfield-Jackson ...

Search query: Atlanta Hartsfield-Jackson International Airport IATA/ICAO
Result: [Doc 1](https://www.world-airport-codes.com/united-states/hartsfield-jackson-atlanta-international-428.html):
Hartsfield Jackson Atlanta Airport Code: ATL USA Hartsfield Jackson Atlanta Airport Code, located in Georgia, USA (GE). It uses the IATA airport code ATL, and ICAO airport code KATL.

[Doc 2](https://acukwik.com/Airport-Info/KATL):
KATL - Hartsfield Jackson Atlanta International - Acukwik ICAO - KATL, IATA - ATL, FAA ID - ATL ; DST. 2nd Sun in Mar 0200L to 1st Sun in Nov 0200L ; Sunrise. 07:42 AM ; Sunset. 05:49 PM ; Open 24 Hours. Yes ; Airport Hours.

[Doc 3](https://www.globalair.com/airport/apt.airport.aspx?aptcode=atl):
ATL - HARTSFIELD/JACKSON ATLANTA INTERNATIONAL Airport ... State, GA ; Airport Identifier: ICAO, KATL ; Airport Identifier: IATA, ATL ; Latitude, 33-38-12.1186N ; Longitude, 084-25-40.3104W.
